CHAT.comment: nina and her mother returned home at four a.m. this morning after a long car ride from santa barbara. nina and her mother have been away for four days. they flew to los angeles for two days. then they took a train to santa barbara where they spent two more days. both families that they stayed with had two children. the mcgintys in los angeles had two girls (erin and gilly). the lovejoys in santa barbara had two boys (nicholas and elijah). linda (nina's mother's younger sister) is visiting. she is in and out during this taping session. nina is sitting on a little chair at a table in her room. she is going to eat some jello. her aunt linda is in a corner reading a novel.

nina points to a playskool game which consists of wooden pegs , parts of houses , cars , and various colored shapes that can be used to construct a village on top of a green peg board . the green peg board has a street , railroad tracks , and a lake drawn on it .

mother takes out some small trees from the playskool box

up till now , nina has been making trees with pegs and balls which are hollowed out to fit onto the pegs . the "trees" her mother just handed to her are models of bushes which stand up by themselves and are not hollowed out to fit onto pegs .
the hole of the peg board

nina takes a small wooden car out of the playskool box and places it on the road which is drawn on the peg board .
pushes her car along the road . she stops next to a "man" constructed out of a peg and a ball .
nina runs the car into a tree and knocks it over
laughs
nina bursts out laughing as she makes her car knock over many trees on the peg board .
mother puts the man made out of a peg and ball in the lake . she takes another car out of the playskool box for herself and puts her car and nina's car at opposite ends of the road .
